posts.author: Rienion
posts.content:
I want to thank Valerfor, and the others for being patient with me, and helping me in where I haven't really gained any knowledge (creating builds). My friend wanted me to play a server called Amia (alongside my arelith time.) and I would like to request a little help in that regard since it's a whole new system. I would like to try and go for the necromancer. Classes such as Palemaster do not seem to be restricted in choice so long as you meet the bare requirements.
Caster Level:
Palemaster levels are counted toward the caster's level when casting spells of the Necromancy school, provided they are arcane in origin (divine-only spells are not affected by this). This includes damage, duration and casting level for the purposes of piercing spell resistance, though due to engine limitations, monk spell resistance is not affected.

Undead Grafts:
The Palemaster has access to an extended selection of undead grafts in order to strengthen their deathless arts.
  • Paralyzing Touch
    6 Palemaster levels
    Paralysis on melee touch attack. Fortitude Save at DC 10 + INT mod + PM level, with a duration of round/Palemaster level.

    Weakening Touch
    6 Palemaster levels
    1d6 STR damage on melee touch attack, Fortitude Save at DC 10 + int mod + PM level. Lasts 1 hour/Palemaster level.

    Degenerative Touch
    7 Palemaster levels
    Level Drain of 1 level on melee touch attack, Fortitude Save at DC 10 + int mod + PM level. Lasts 1 hour/Palemaster level.

    Commanding Touch
    8 Palemaster levels
    As "Control Undead" on melee touch attack, with caster level (wizard + sorcerer + PM levels), lasting for (wizard + sorcerer + PM level) rounds. Will Save at DC 10 + int mod + PM level.

    Destructive Touch
    9 Palemaster levels
    1d6 CON damage on melee touch attack, Fortitude Save at DC 10 + int mod + PM level, successful save negates CON damage. Lasts 1 hour/Palemaster level.

    Deathless Touch
    10 Palemaster levels
    Death on melee touch attack. Fortitude Save at DC 10 + INT mod + PM level.

    These would be the class changes from the looks of it, but I need a little guidance.

    Edit: Also appears to be no class taking limit like 3 levels before switch etc.

posts.author: Rienion
posts.content:
Summon spell changes I think
Overview:
These are the summon options of the Palemaster prestige class.

Details:
These abilities compliment the Palemaster's magical skill with frontline toughness.

Caster Level is calculated as the sum of your spellcaster class level and Palemaster class levels. It is used to determine both the power of your undead summon and its duration. Note that Bard levels are not counted for Palemaster summons.

Animate Dead [Duration: 24 hours]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9 - 14 : Wraith
• CL 15+ : Dread Wraith

• The Palemaster gains a bonus +1 to CL when using this ability.
• The summoned undead gains +2 to Turn Resistance.
Create Undead [Duration: 1 Round / CL]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9 – 14 : Wraith
• CL 15 – 19 : Dread Wraith
• CL 20 – 23 : Wight
• CL 24 - 27 : Mummy
• CL 28+ : Greater Mummy

• The Palemaster gains a bonus +2 to CL when using this ability.
• The summoned undead gains +4 to Turn Resistance.
Create Greater Undead [Duration: 1 Turn / CL]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9 – 14 : Wraith
• CL 15 – 19 : Dread Wraith
• CL 20 – 23 : Wight
• CL 24 – 27 : Mummy
• CL 28 - 31 : Greater Mummy
• CL 32+ : Winterwight

• The Palemaster gains a bonus +3 to CL when using this ability.
• The summoned undead gains +6 to Turn Resistance.
Overview:
Undead creation spells all use the same pool of creatures, increasing the power ceiling based on the strength of the spell used (from Animate Dead to Create Greater Undead).

Details:
As these spells are of the spell school of Necromancy, Palemaster levels are included toward the caster level for both duration and power.

Animate Dead [Duration: 24 hours]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9+ : Wraith
Create Undead [Duration: 1 Round / CL]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9 – 14 : Wraith
• CL 15 – 19 : Dread Wraith
• CL 20 – 23 : Wight
• CL 24+ : Mummy
Create Greater Undead [Duration: 1 Turn / CL]

• CL 1 – 8 : Mohrg
• CL 9 – 14 : Wraith
• CL 15 – 19 : Dread Wraith
• CL 20 – 23 : Wight
• CL 24 – 27 : Mummy
• CL 28+ : Greater Mummy

Having the ability for stronger summons hardly matters if the A.I isn't up to the task for example. And all that i see are flavour changes, that won't increase your build's power. And in a Level 30 environment taking pale-master at all is going to be a tough undertaking.

OK, so you want a lvl 30 PM build, yes?

Man, please next time do say that in the OP (Original Post). I wouldn't have minded before, but recently the forum has changed so you can't copy/paste here anymore without losing the format, so after I pasted the build here I had to press enter about 100 times to get it to the right format, only to find out that you won't use it. It's ok cuz you just started, I'm not mad, but for future reference, the server level cap is a very important piece of the puzzle and you need to provide it. Thanks.

What I'm going to do for you is adapt that build I posted for level 30, but you will lose LOTS of power. You may be wondering why, let me tell you: My build had 3 Epic Bonus Feats from Wizard, plus craft wand and scribe scrolls, and two very nice (and unattainable at level 30) epic spells. So you are going to lose a few Bonus Feats from Wizard before level 20, the epic spells, you are going to lose the undispellability (which is BAD for a mage who relies on spells), you are going to lose penetration, so Spell Resistance will be a problem to overcome, etc.. And what will you gain? Summons. Bad, ugly, easy-to-kill, worthless summons. Seriously, the way you put things here it sounds as though you think that a Greater Mummy is good. Have they been changed in Amia? In regular NWN a Greater Mummy is a crappy foe that dies in one round to all my toons at any level they face them. Unlike Valerfor suggested I have no idea what the server is like, so if they have changed, if the AI has been tweaked, that may be worth something. So I will ask you before I spend my time making you this build: ARE YOU SURE you want a Wizard with 10 PM levels in a lvl 30 world?

I'll wait for your reply.

Spell Focus: Abjuration
  • Each Spell Focus in Abjuration grants a cumulative +2 to Dispelling Rolls, to a total of +6 with Epic Spell Focus: Abjuration. These are applied after the Level Cap imposed by individual spells (so an Epic Abjurer's Greater Dispelling caps at +36, not +30).
  • With Spell Focus: Abjuration, the Shield spell protects against Isaac's Lesser Missile Storm as well as Magic Missile. With Greater Spell Focus, this protection extends also to Isaac's Greater Missile Storm.
  • With Epic Spell Focus: Abjuration, the -ward and -ward teleport Commands become available. The character may use one or the other of these, once per rest. -ward creates a large visible symbol on the floor, which lasts for a long time and inflicts brief paralysis on enemies who fail a Will Save upon passing over it. -ward teleport, while it lasts, prevents any PC from teleporting out of the area in question through any means, and prevents them from being -yoinked elsewhere whilst the remain in the area. It also prevents travel to any portals within the area.
Spell Focus: Conjuration
  • Each Spell Focus in Conjuration grants a small bonus to the statistics of creatures summoned by the [Lesser/Greater] Planar Binding Spells, and Epic Spell: Dragon Knight.
  • Greater Spell Focus: Conjuration causes a caster to summon a creature one "level" higher than normal when using the Summon Creature I-VIII spells, in the same way as the bonus provided by the Cleric's Animal Domain. Note that Animal Domain and Greater Spell Focus: Conjuration do not stack in this respect. This feat will also grant Fiendish Warlocks an empowered version of their final summon, and allows Summon Creature IX to summon a more powerful Ancient Elemental.
  • Epic Spell Focus: Conjuration enables the -yoink command. Once per rest, a character may send -yoink as a tell to another PC, which will cause them to enter a dialogue telling them that your PC is attempting to summon them. If they accept, they are transported instantly to your location.
Spell Focus: Divination
  • Spell Focus: Divination allows a character using the *looks* command to see whether a character is "attuned" to Life, Death, Fire, Water, Earth, or Air. This information is displayed even if the target is disguised. Through trial and error association, a player may learn much about another character's habits and abilities from their attunement. Also allows a character to use the mysterious and rare Deck of Stars item.
  • With Epic Spell Focus: Divination, the -scry command becomes available. Once per rest, with the Clairaudience/Clairvoyance spell active, the character may send -scry as a tell to another PC (or type -scry [START OF TARGET'S NAME]). This permits the character to spy on their target for roughly one minute. It is possible to protect against this, but means of doing so are considered Find Out In Game information.
Spell Focus: Enchantment
  • Each Spell Focus in Enchantment reduces the base cost of an enchantment when using the Enchantment Basin. This, in turn, means the chances of success with any given enchantment are increased, and that more valuable/powerful items can be created.
  • The (non-cumulative) reduction in costs are 10% for Spell Focus, 20% for Greater Spell Focus, and 35% for Epic Spell Focus.
Spell Focus: Evocation
  • Epic Spell Focus: Evocation drastically improves both Epic Spell: Greater Ruin and Epic Spell: Hellball, to several times their normal effectiveness. Without this focus, their power is equivalent to Vanilla NWN.
Spell Focus: Illusion
  • Epic Spell Focus: Illusion enables the -send_image command. Once per rest, the character may send -send_image XXXX as a tell to another PC (or type -send_image [START OF TARGET'S NAME] XXXX), where "XXXX" is the message they wish to send. Your character's avatar, with the appropriate *conjures* or *casts* visual and/or polymorph state, will appear like a Speedy Messenger beside the target and relate your message. If you are targeting a PC on a different server, they will instead see only a "Mysterious Ball of Light".
Spell Focus: Necromancy
  • Greater Spell Focus: Necromancy turns Summoned Undead (from any Spell, Class Ability or Feat except Epic Spell: Mummy Dust) into Henchmen. Your character may therefore use such an ability twice (or two such abilities once), and have two undead at the same time. You may also have a normally summoned creature in addition to those two.
  • Epic Spell Focus: Necromancy means that all abilities which summon undead summon two, with one casting.
Spell Focus: Transmutation
  • Greater Spell Focus: Transmutation allows a character, by travelling to the correct place (the location of which is Find Out In Game information), to activate Golems from their constituent parts so long as the character is Level 15 or over.
  • Epic Spell Focus: Transmutation enables the -teleport command. This allows the character to open the same dialogue they receive at an One-Way Entrance or Two-Way Portal. Once per rest, they may select one of these at a cost of 5 Spell components, and travel there as if using a portal.

posts.content:
Hey man!

It's hard to say because I haven't played there to actually see it happening and know which things are useful and which things are not. The focus in Necromancy is traditional for regular Neverwinter Nights to increase the DCs of insta-death spells like Finger of Death and Wail of the Banshee. From what I could see, I like Abjuration a lot, Conjuration also seems nice, but it will depend on how you play your character. That decision has to be yours, brother. Ask people in Arelith about the schools to focus in, and you'll get your answer for sure.

Here in the ECB, we are good at building generic powerful toons, but it's customary for the buildee (in this case you) to apply the server-specific tweaks TO the build. I may have read all these focuses, but there are many things there that I don't understand and have never seen before such as Enchantment Basin, for example. The typing commands are also Arelith-only, and since I won't be playing in Arelith, I truly CAN'T tell you which schools to focus in. If you were playing on WoG, I could tell you, because I know the server very well. For Arelith stuff, better ask Arelith players.
